docs.snippet: The Baltimore Orioles and Washington Nationals met in court over their shared network, MASN, highlighting several problems with cable sports broadcasting....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Baltimore Orioles and Washington Nationals met in court over their shared network, MASN, highlighting several problems with cable sports broadcasting.
docs.abstract: Richard Sandomir Sports Business column examines court case between Baltimore Orioles and Washington Nationals, two first-place MLB teams that share same market and are both carried by the Mid-Atlantic Sports Network; argues that case, including battle over money and accusations of extortion and conflicts of interests, highlights several problems with cable sports broadcasting.

headline.seo: MASN Pits Orioles Against Nationals After Years of Coexistence
headline.main: The Market? Shared. The Network? Divided.
headline.print_headline: The Market? Shared. The Network? Divided.

docs.abstract: Batting slump of New York Mets third baseman David Wright is fueling speculation that shoulder injury he sustained during awkward slide in June game is hampering him more than he lets on.

headline.main: Wright’s Innocuous Slide Precedes a Precipitous Tumble
